item.title: Introduction
item.description: Mission hypathia.net aims to provide a blueprint for operating a service to provide cloud based computing resources in a self-service manner. It presents an opinionated selection of components, configurations and practices tailored to environments that have a specific set of requirements, often found at academic institutions. Assumed Requirements These are the main requirements that shaped the specific characteristics of hypathia.net: The organisation cannot use computing resources of a public cloud provider This may be due to procurement rules, legal obligations or the wish to run highly sensitive workloads in-house, rather than on hardware that the organization has virtually no control over.

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: Infrastructure Environment You will need a network with Internet access as well as a sufficient number of available IP addresses. Be sure to allow for growth (even when successful beyond your wildest dreams!). Migrating the cluster from one network to another is possible, but not for the faint of heart. a DNS domain and a mechanism to integrate it with your super-domain (eg. compute-cloud.example.com). entries for all your users in an Directory System that allows access via LDAP.

item.title: More Deployment Mojo
item.description: Deploying into the ICC Picture the build pipeline of GitLab has finally succeeded and created a new container image. Naturally, now I want to have the pipeline deploy it into the cluster. Or to be more precise, to change the configuration of the cluster in such a manner, that it will pull the new image and then restart the ports according to the update rules of Deployments and Replica Sets.
